conbody.p: Kafka Producer destinationenabling SSL securityPerform the following steps to enable the Kafka Producer to use SSL to connect to . You can use the same steps to configure a Kafka Consumer.

ol.li: To use SSL to connect, first make sure Kafka is configured for SSL as described in the Kafka documentation: .
On the General tab of the stage, set the Stage Library property to Apache Kafka 0.9.0.0.
On the Kafka tab, add the security.protocol Kafka configuration property and set it to SSL.

Then, add the following SSL Kafka configuration properties:
ssl.truststore.location
ssl.truststore.password
When the Kafka broker requires client authentication - when the ssl.client.auth broker property is set to "required" - add and configure the following properties:
ssl.keystore.location
ssl.keystore.password
ssl.key.password
Some brokers might require adding the following properties as well:
ssl.enabled.protocols
ssl.truststore.type
ssl.keystore.type
For details about these properties, see the Kafka documentation.
